result.execSummary:
The defendant Levi S. Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Contact with the victim-V. Stewart-as authorized by supervising agent.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Defendant is to complete a Parenting Class to be arranged through P & P and Waushara County Dept. of Human Services.    Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 12 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

2:31 pm case called. Defendant Levi S. Stewart in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over matter on calendar and deferred sentencing agreement entered in December 2014. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding sentencing. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson-parenting class has not been completed per agreement. Statement by Attorney Rashid regarding sentencing. Statement by defendant. Court questions defendant regarding community service. Defendant makes statement regarding failure to complete community service. Court makes statement regarding agreement and order previously entered. Court finds a material breach of sentencing agreement and sets aside agreement-matter postured for sentencing. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Rashid. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 18 months. CONDITIONS: Complete a Parenting class to be arranged through P & P and Waushara County DHS, Complete AODA and follow through, Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Contact with V. Stewart as authorized through Probation Agent. 75 hours Community Service. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court will grant early termination after 12 months with agreement of supervising agent. DNA surcharge assessed-no sample to be provided. Court admonishes defendant regarding expungment through DOJ. Appeal Rights Given.
Proof of Community Service completed by the Defendant for the Month of February 2017
Proof of Community Service completed by the Defendant for the Month of January 2017 - DE requesting to do community service at the Waushara County Food Pantry - Granted by the Court
Sentencing hearing on March 14, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

2:03 pm case called. Defendant Levi S. Stewart in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over previous hearings and status of matter. Court questions counsel regarding compliance. Attorney Rashid requests the court re-appoint him on this matter as he was a Dean appointment and adjourns the sentencing hearing. Court will grant the request and tolls the time limitation and agreement will continue and evaluation. Court orders $200 payment to re-appoint Attorney Rashid by February 1, 2017 and $100 per month towards those fees commencing March 1, 2017.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 26, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: re: Deferred Sentence

10:25 am case called. Defendant Levi S. Stewart in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader-agreement reached with an argued sentence. Amend Count 1 to CDTP in violation of 943.01. Count 2 remains as charged. Additional Count 3-CDTP in violation of 943.01. Attorney Rashid and defendant concur.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts amendments as stated by DA Blader.  Plea: No Contest to  Counts 1, 2, & 3.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Rashid. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court to defendant prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNTS 1 & 3: Deferred Sentencing for a period of 2 years-Court imposed deferred sentencing with the following conditions. Complete DAAP through CAP Services. Complete AODA through DHS and provide documentation. Complete any parenting course determined by DHS. Any counseling or treatment by DHS is to be completed. 150 hours of Community Service to County Cupboard or Habitat for Humanity-to be completed no less than 5 hours per month, reported to Court. Court will amend the bond to require:  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No corpral punishment or force with children. If defendant successfully completes court will impose court costs. To be drafted by Attorney Rashid and provided to court within a week. COUNT 2-30 days WCJ to be served no later than January 2, 2015. Sentence with Good Time Credit-No Huber. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars. Defendant to take all prescribed medications as ordered by treating physician.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

2:11 pm case called. Defendant Levi S. Stewart in court with attorney David C Rashid.  Steven P Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing waived by defendant. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read criminal complaint and finds probable cause a felony offense has been committed within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial of those charges. Bond modification request by Attorney Rashid. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding bond modification request. Information filed by ADA Anderson. Attorney Rashid confirms receipt and waives formal reading. Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 02:40 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Case Called @ 1:18 pm: Defendant Levi S. Stewart in court.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def states he was denied representation by SPD.  Prepared to file a petition for appointment of counsel.  Denial for SPD was based upon retirement fund asset.  Currently is not working due to medical issues.  Court will appoint counsel upon the payment of a deposit in the amount of $250.00 no later than 5/1/14, with a payment plan to commence on 6/1/14 at $50/mo -  determines Def is not indigent, Def will be responsible for legal fees incurred. IA scheduled - NOH Given.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on April 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Case Called @ 1:50 PM: Defendant Levi S. Stewart in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court understands that counsel issues need to be addressed by SPD before eligibility can be confirmed.  IA adjourned.  NOH personally given.  Def to keep in contact with SPD to determine eligiblity isuses.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on April 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars. Defendant to take all prescribed medications as ordered by treating physician.

Case called @ 1:12 p.m. Defendant Levi S. Stewart in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD subject to verification. DA Blader requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Keberlein. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond w/ conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
